DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Estrogen Receptor Status Genetic Testing Outcome
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The result of Estrogen Receptor (ER) genetic analysis.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._The estrogen receptor level measured in a primary tumor or in metastases.  There are essentially two distinct forms of breast cancer, one that tends to have an early onset and is characterized by an ER- status, and one that tends to have a late onset and is characterized by an ER+ status.  However, these two variants tend to overlap with respect to age, so it is possible for a young woman to have a "late-onset" form of breast cancer and for an older woman to have an "early-onset" variant of the disease.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: The estrogen receptor level measured in a primary tumor or in metastases.  There are essentially two distinct forms of breast cancer, one that tends to have an early onset and is characterized by an ER- status, and one that tends to have a late onset and

Concepts.definition: The estrogen receptor level measured in a primary tumor or in metastases.  There are essentially two distinct forms of breast cancer, one that tends to have an early onset and is characterized by an ER- status, and one that tends to have a late onset and is characterized by an ER+ status.  However, these two variants tend to overlap with respect to age, so it is possible for a young woman to have a "late-onset" form of breast cancer and for an older woman to have an "early-onset" variant of the disease.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

DataElementConcept.origin: MCL:Molecular and Cellular Characterization of Screened Lesions
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 3/3/22 jk released as part of quarterly content review and prior reviews with SMEs.  5/20/19 jk created for Initial Diagnosis module; added CSI for diagnosis and surgical therapy.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Estrogen Receptor Test Genetic Testing Outcome
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A lab test to find out if cancer cells have estrogen receptors (proteins to which estrogen will bind). If the cells have estrogen receptors, they may need estrogen to grow, and this may affect how the cancer is treated._The process of isolating and testing the DNA of an embryo or a person to detect the presence of genetic alterations or defects that may predispose to the future development of a disease or disorder._The result of an action.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Data from an original source is not present, accessible or ready for use or service.

Concepts.definition: Data from an original source is not present, accessible or ready for use or service.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not yet decided or settled; awaiting conclusion or confirmation.

Concepts.definition: Not yet decided or settled; awaiting conclusion or confirmation.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated VM Short Name to be the Public ID to be consistent with current convention for VM Short Name - DW 10-03-2022

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Indicates that a test was not performed.

Concepts.definition: Indicates that a test was not performed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that a reason or result cannot be established.

Concepts.definition: An indication that a reason or result cannot be established.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Describes cells that do not have a protein to which the hormone estrogen will bind. Cancer cells that are estrogen receptor negative do not need estrogen to grow, and usually do not stop growing when treated with hormones that block estrogen from binding.

Concepts.definition: The absence of detectable estrogen receptor alpha in a tissue sample.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A minimum level or position or degree; less than normal in degree, intensity or amount.: An indication that estrogen receptor alpha expression has been detected in a sample.

Concepts.definition: A minimum level or position or degree; less than normal in degree, intensity or amount.
An indication that estrogen receptor alpha expression has been detected in a sample.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Describes cells that have a receptor protein that binds the hormone estrogen. Cancer cells that are estrogen receptor positive may need estrogen to grow, and may stop growing or die when treated with substances that block the binding and actions of estrogen.

Concepts.definition: An indication that estrogen receptor alpha expression has been detected in a sample.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Estrogen Receptor Test Genetic Testing Outcome
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A lab test to find out if cancer cells have estrogen receptors (proteins to which estrogen will bind). If the cells have estrogen receptors, they may need estrogen to grow, and this may affect how the cancer is treated.:The process of isolating and testing the DNA of an embryo or a person to detect the presence of genetic alterations or defects that may predispose to the future development of a disease or disorder.:The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: A lab test to find out if cancer cells have estrogen receptors (proteins to which estrogen will bind). If the cells have estrogen receptors, they may need estrogen to grow, and this may affect how the cancer is treated.
The process of isolating and testing the DNA of an embryo or a person to detect the presence of genetic alterations or defects that may predispose to the future development of a disease or disorder.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/1/22 mr Released per SME.   12/2/21 mr Created for MCL PCA breast per DCT.
